intro: Pterocaulon spicatum var. brachystachyum, commonly known as the short-stalked pterocaulon, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves arranged in a basal rosette, and its inflorescence consists of small, yellowish flowers clustered in short spikes. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
